column4: I am really at my wits end here, cause I'm literally driving blind
my laptop's primary screen is broken
trying to swtich to the second monitor
the second monitor works and displays fine on the livecd
when I boot into ubuntu it turns off that display
how on earth can I swtich it if I can't see? :(
if you can find the documentation for your laptop, there should be a key combination to switch your display between the laptops display and external display..
I've tried the key combination that should switch monitors, doesn't work though :/
or you can do what I did with an old dell laptop. I physically removed the broken screen from the laptop and it then defaulted to the external display.
ha, I'm not sure I'm at that point yet but I'll add that to my list of options
the problem is, everything works ok on the livecd. I don't know why it would suddenly turn off the second display once I booted in proper
other than the key combo and removing the broken screen that's all the ideas I have atm.
I think the live cd mirrors all displays by default
but once installed it will only work on what the system thinks is the primary display
at least until comfigured differently
if you wanted to do the research or can get someone good with bash scripting, you could possibly work out a boot script to configure the external display as primary.
I'm trying to blind install openssh-server so I can at least edit the configs and such
not easy :(
what is the config file the open source drivers use? Xorg.conf isn't present
I'm pretty sure openssh-server automatically starts after install. I wonder if putting 'apt-get -y install openssh-server' in rc.local would work. Then remove it after you have ssh access
hmm ok I'll try that
I believe the current x-org doesn't use it unless you specifically need it for speacial hardware/support.
